title: Teen, 16, rushed to hospital after 'acid attack' following fight in south London
text:
A teenager has been rushed to hospital after a suspected acid attack following a fight.

Metropolitan Police said the 16-year-old was found to have had a 'corrosive substance thrown at him' in South Norwood, south London. No arrests have been made.

A cordon has been put up in the area as officers investigate the horror.

Metropolitan Police said the 16-year-old was found to have had a 'corrosive substance thrown at him' in South Norwood, south London. No arrests have been made (the area is pictured)

'He was taken by the London Ambulance Service to a South London hospital for treatment,' a spokesman for the Met said.

'His injuries are not believed to be life-threatening. There have been no arrests and enquiries continue.'

One person tweeted: 'Some boy in South Norwood got acid dashed in his face today. I just don't understand why people are so evil man.'
description: Metropolitan Police said the teenager was found to have had a 'corrosive substance thrown at him' in South Norwood, south London.
